result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorenzo Villanueva Rincon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lorenzo Villanueva Rincon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lorenzo Villanueva Rincon was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined at a hearing to be held on May 25, 2016 at 1:30 pm. **On May 25, 2016 the Court entered Restitution in the amount of $684.89, severally. Court orders the defendant to pay $50.00 per month commencing July 1, 2016 towards Restitution. $150.00 cash bond previously posted paid directly to victim-J. Puentes by Clerk of Courts.**

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with the victim as named in the complaint.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
**On May 25, 2016 the Court granted the request of the defendant to travel from Wisconsin, USA to Mexico to visit his father from July 20, 2016 and returning no later than August 6, 2016 to Wisconsin.**
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorenzo Villanueva Rincon

records.addlTxt: Bond posted in Kenosha

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from the Court granting the DE permission to travel to Mexico
from the DE requesting permission to travel out of the country
Exhibits #1-#3

Defendant Lorenzo Villanueva Rincon in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Enrique Soria and Karyn Simmons sworn. State calls Jesus Puente, witness sworn by clerk, testimony given. Exhibit #1, #2, #3 offered and received by Court. Cross exam by Attorney Christopher. Court questions witness. Attorney Christopher calls Lorenzo Villanueva Rincon, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross exam by ADA Anderson. Attorney Christopher calls Angelica Villenuava, witness sworn, testimony given. Court make statement and finds Mr. Puentes incurred $4109.31 in damages in medical treatment as a result of the incident. Court finds defendant owes $684.89 in Restitution, severally. Court orders $50.00 per month commening July 1, 2016. Court orders cash bond be applied to restitution first. Statement by Attorney Christopher regarding request for the defendant to visit his father. Court allows travel from Wisconsin and USA to Mexico for the defendant to visit his father from July 20, 2016 and returning August 6, 2016.
Restitution hearing on May 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

9:45 am case called. Defendant Lorenzo Villanueva Rincon in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Enrique Soria, interpreter, sworn by Court. Agreement reached and stated on record-argued sentence.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 1.  Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Christopher. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Imposed 60 days WCJ, STAYED and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact w/victim as named in the complaint. Restitution-TBD. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Restitution hearing to be set. Appeal Rights Given.  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 09:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Marc Efton Christopher in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Per Atty Christopher:  Still investigating Restitution request.  Suggests brief adjournment for him to confer again with his client.  P/S Scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Status conference at 03-08-2016 09:40 am

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Marc Efton Christopher in court,  appearing via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Counsel continue to investigate and agree to further STC being scheduled.  STC adjourned as requested.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 09:40 am.
Restitution Summary and Statement of Loss/Damages - $4109.31
State's

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 2:34 p.m. Defendant Lorenzo Villanueva Rincon in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher. Enrique Soria present to interpret. Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP entered. Court orders $150 Cash Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 09:35 am.
